item.title: Report E-2025040276
item.description:
Report E-2025040276

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 01:51 EDT on 3/14, XPO-UDV contacted ERTS to report 2 spills in the same trailer. Two 15-gal poly drums, one containing "AQUANOMIC 2.0 LOW TEMP LAUNDRY DESTAINER" and the other containing "AQUA BALANCE MURIATIC ACID," were damaged due to improper loading at LDA. About 1 cup of each product spilled onto the trailer floor. Both materials are class 8 corrosive, and ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist with cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and found there was approximately (1) cup released from UN1791 Aquanomic 2.0 Low Temp Laundry Destainer impacting 2’x2’ of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The drum of Muriatic Acid was shake tested and showed no signs of a release. The crew cleaned the release and overpacked the damaged container of product into a 55-gallon poly drum, PPE, poly liner and impacted rags were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025040082
item.description:
Report E-2025040082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Flight 1316 LAX-JFK diverted to DEN due to having an e-cigarette with a lithium battery loaded in the belly of the aircraft. Two bags were checked in at the kiosk (1 grey duffle and 1 orange bag) and one grey duffle bag was checked in at the gate. Notified the gate agent, that lithium batteries were in his checked bag. Using the Bag Request App, gate agent informed the GO supervisors to get his baggage. He attempted to board the plane with three personal belongings at 00:41. Gate agent informed CUS that he had to check in one bag. The CUS stated that he wanted to reorganize the items in his baggage and that he had tools that included lithium batteries. The bag was taken and placed on the AC once it had been reorganized. The jetbridge was pulled from the AC and the GO crew was waiting to push. CUS told Inflight that there was an e-cigarette in his gate check. The jetbridge was pulled back up to the AC so that the Gate Agent could speak with him. GO was notified to get CUS' gate check bag. The originally requested bag was pulled thus leaving the gate check and 1 other checked bag on the AC. When they arrived at DEN, they discovered an e-cigarette in one bag and a laptop in the other.
